intro: Chrysosplenium alternifolium var. rosendahlii, commonly known as the Rosendahl's alternateleaf chrysosplenium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Saxifragaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a subtle ornamental value. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in its native range.
